message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.DS 

This paper is primarily focused on the geometric properties of deep neural network classifiers, which is a topic that falls under the umbrella of machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper specifically analyzes the topology of classification regions and decision boundaries in the input space, which suggests that it could also be categorized under cs.CV (Computer Vision). The paper also discusses the sensitivity of deep networks to additive perturbations in the inputs, which is a topic that falls under the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Furthermore, the paper leverages the curvature of the decision boundary to detect small adversarial perturbations in images, which suggests that it could also be categorized under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
